Problem:
Consider a linear system characterized by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\), where L is a linear differential operator. We explore how the application of the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F}(u) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} e^{-ix\\xi} u(x,t) dx \\) affects the system.

If \\( \\mathcal{F}(u) \\) is applied to a function \\( u(x, 0) \\) at time t = 0 and then allowed to evolve according to \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\) without further intervention, will the function \\( u(x, T) \\) at time T under the Fourier transform evolve similarly to \\( u(x, T) \\) without the Fourier transform?
Explanation: The Fourier transform changes the representation from spatial domain to frequency domain, altering how the operator L acts on \\( u(x, T) \\). This transformation can potentially change the solution significantly due to the modification of boundary conditions and internal structure of L in the frequency space.
